entry.title: 外科医生佩戴 Vision Pro 进行腹腔镜手术
entry.content:
安德鲁·R·周 (Andrew R. Chow)，《时代》杂志报道：

二十四年前，外科医生圣地亚哥·霍根（Santiago Horgan）进行了世界上首例机器人辅助胃绕道手术，这是一项重大的医学突破。现在，Horgan 正在开发一种新工具，他认为这种工具可能会在手术室中带来更大的变革：Apple Vision Pro。

上个月，霍根和加州大学圣地亚哥分校的其他外科医生佩戴 Apple 混合现实耳机进行了 20 多次微创手术。

这个特定用例的细节主要与人体工程学有关，Vision Pro 提供的优势似乎意义深远：

在腹腔镜手术中，医生将微型摄像机穿过患者身体的小切口，摄像机的图像投射到监视器上。然后，医生必须在抬头看着屏幕的同时对患者进行手术，这是一项手眼协调的棘手任务，同时在加压环境中处理其他视觉变量。 “我通常会转身停下手术去看 CT 扫描；看看内窥镜检查（另一个可以近距离观察器官的小型相机）发生了什么；查看心率监视器，”霍根说。

因此， 2022 年的一项研究发现，大多数外科医生在进行微创手术时都会感到不适。大约五分之一的受访外科医生表示，他们会考虑提前退休，因为他们的疼痛非常频繁且不舒服。那么，一款好的混合现实耳机可以让外科医生无需抬头就能看到患者的手术区域，虚拟屏幕上会显示腹腔镜摄像头和患者的生命体征。

20% 的外科医生表示，他们正在考虑提前退休，因为这个数字很高！ Vision Pro 3,500-4,000 美元的价格在这种情况下不仅是可以接受的，而且是彻头彻尾的便宜货：

加州大学圣地亚哥分校健康中心首席临床和创新官克里斯托弗·朗赫斯特 (Christopher Longhurst) 表示，虽然 Vision Pro 3,499 美元的价格可能会让普通消费者望而却步，但与大多数医疗设备相比，它的价格并不昂贵。 “手术室里的显示器大概要 20,000 到 30,000 美元，”他说。 “因此，3,500 美元的耳机对于医疗保健环境来说就像预算灰尘一样。”

让我想知道这些高端专业和工业用例对于这十年的 Vision 平台来说是否就像桌面出版对于 80 年代的 Mac 一样？领先大众市场多年，但对于一个历史悠久的行业来说是革命性的突破。对于业内人士来说，这是一个如此明显的价值，以至于他们不仅矛盾地接受这个新平台，而且迫不及待地转向它们。该平台从繁荣到繁荣，都会有一个转折点，它会扩展到大众市场。 1992 年，我在大学二年级进入平面设计和桌面出版领域，那时平面设计和专业印刷行业完全基于 Macintosh，但该平台（包括 LaserWriter）只有 6 或 7 年的历史。

但在 1984 年秋天，麦金塔电脑被认为是失败的。

★

entry.title: iOS 18.2 Beta 1 中的每一项新功能和变化
entry.content:
9to5Mac 的 Chance Miller 完成了为 iOS 18.2 beta 1 提供完整图文并茂的变更日志的工作。这是我没想到的，但现在我想起来，这并不奇怪：

iOS 18.2 允许用户为全球范围内的消息传递和通话设置默认应用程序。这是通过“设置”应用程序中的新“默认”菜单进行管理的，您可以在其中为美国的这些应用程序设置默认值：

  • 电子邮件
  • 消息传递
  • 呼唤
  • 呼叫过滤
  • 浏览器应用程序
  • 密码和代码
  • 键盘

显然，如果欧盟委员会不要求 DMA 合规性，那么世界上任何地方的 iOS 18.2 都不会出现这种情况，但考虑到苹果必须为欧盟做到这一点，为什么不在全球范围内做到这一点呢？从苹果的角度来看，这并不是一个“我们认为这是一个坏主意”的事情，就像其他应用程序商店一样。这是一个“我们认为这不是那么重要的想法”的事情。

Apple 不会优先考虑但并不完全反对的 DMA 合规性功能可能会在全球范围内提供。苹果反对的功能仍将是欧盟独有的。例如，在欧盟的 iOS 18.2 beta 1 中，用户现在可以“删除”照片和相机等应用程序。这是一个非常愚蠢的想法，所以它只适用于欧盟。

entry.title: Apple Intelligence 推出的第二阶段开始，iOS 18.2 和 MacOS 15.2 的开发人员 Beta 版发布
entry.content:
朱莉·克洛弗，MacRumors：

Apple 今天向开发者发布了即将推出的 iOS 18.2、iPadOS 18.2 和 macOS Sequoia 15.2 更新的第一个 Beta 版，以进行测试。测试版已经发布，而苹果仍在开发 iOS 18.1、iPadOS 18.1 和 macOS Sequoia 15.1，更新将于下周发布。

苹果正在分批推出Apple Intelligence 功能，虽然下周推出的第一波规模相对较小，但下一波规模相当大。 iOS 18.2 和 MacOS 15.2 的首批开发人员测试版包括：Mail、Genmoji、Image Playgrounds（包括 Image Wand，其中 Notes 中的粗略草图可以转换为详细图像）中的分类和优先收件箱排序，以及 ChatGPT 的集成以实现更复杂的功能“世界知识”的要求。并且，对于 iPhone 16 用户，视觉智能。

这些开发人员测试版还包含适用于第三方应用程序的新 API：书写工具 API（这将允许任何文本应用程序支持只有 Apple 的第一方应用程序在 iOS 18.1 和 MacOS 15.1 中才能访问的功能）、Genmoji API（因此第三方- 派对消息应用程序可以像消息一样支持它们）和 Image Playground API。

随着下周首次公开发布 iOS 18.1 和 MacOS 15.1，WWDC 上宣布的大多数 Apple Intelligence 功能仍然缺失。在这些新的开发者测试版中，只有少数功能仍然缺失：优先通知，以及 Siri 的更高级功能，例如应用内操作和个人知识背景（“我妈妈的航班何时到达？”功能）。

entry.title: 道奇队传奇人物费尔南多·巴伦苏埃拉 (Fernando Valenzuela) 去世，享年 63 岁，正值自 1981 年成为明星球员以来，洋基队与道奇队首次举行世界大赛的风口浪尖
entry.content:
安迪·麦卡洛，《The Athletic》报道：

道奇队证实，墨西哥左撇子费尔南多·巴伦苏埃拉于周二去世，他在洛杉矶道奇队的新秀赛季成为洛杉矶的偶像，并在接下来的四十年里一直是球队充满活力的一部分。他 63 岁了。[...]

2023 年，道奇队认识到了巴伦苏埃拉在球队传奇中不可磨灭的地位，为此改变了俱乐部政策以纪念他：巴伦苏埃拉成为第一个在没有进入名人堂的情况下就退役了球衣的道奇队球员。在 2023 年 8 月的颁奖典礼之前，当他的 34 号球衣出现在道奇体育场，位于桑迪·库法克斯 (Sandy Koufax) 的 32 号球衣和罗伊·坎帕内拉 (Roy Campanella) 的 39 号球衣之间时，巴伦苏埃拉表示自己感到震惊。

“我从来没有想过会发生这种事，”巴伦苏埃拉说。 “就像我新秀年参加世界大赛一样，我从来没有想过会发生这种情况。”

我年纪还小，还记得费尔南多狂热，但它确实引起了全国性的轰动。每个人都知道“费尔南多”是谁，即使是那些对棒球几乎不关心或根本不关心的人。我认识的每个孩子，无论男孩还是女孩，都想要一张费尔南多棒球卡（或贴纸——当时流行棒球贴纸）。

1978 年，17 岁的巴伦苏埃拉 (Valenzuela) 在墨西哥一个贫穷的农民家庭的 12 个孩子中排行第 12，在一个默默无闻的墨西哥职业联赛中投球。道奇队的一名球探去评估对方球队的游击手，却发现自己被巴伦苏埃拉的投球迷住了。两年后，他在赛季末被大联盟牛棚征召入伍。

然后到了 1981 年。由于道奇队的先发球员意外受伤，巴伦苏埃拉成为了他们开幕当天的先发投手。他完成了整场比赛的绝杀。他以8胜0负的赛季开局，自责失分率为0.50 。他在这 8 场比赛中每场都投了全部 9 局。他最好的投球是一个螺旋球（一种以“错误”方式弯曲的破球）——一种甚至没有人再投的过去的投球。他的体格更像是啤酒联盟而不是大联盟。他的结局夸张得可笑——更像是兔八哥，而不是典型的大联盟投手。 1981年世界大赛第3场，他带领道奇队以2比0的比分战胜了道奇队最受鄙视的对手洋基队，并在接下来的3场比赛中获胜，夺得了冠军。他同时获得了年度最佳新秀奖和赛扬奖。当时他几乎不会说英语，但他具有打破任何语言障碍的魅力。他当时20岁。

当时我8岁，已经是一个非常痛苦的失败者。巴伦苏埃拉是我记忆中第一个让我对对方球队怀有复杂感情的运动员。你就是忍不住喜欢他。

查看更多： “ Remembering Fernandomania ”——MLB 几年前制作的一部精彩的 11 分钟短片。这部电影很好地强调了巴伦苏埃拉对洛杉矶墨西哥裔美国人社区的意义。他的职业生涯全盛时期已经是 40 年前，但他对道奇队与当时还很新的家乡城市的关系的影响至今仍然显而易见。

还有一个：观看 2017 年的这段视频，不要起鸡皮疙瘩。我赌你。

★

entry.title: Intuit 的公关团队似乎从未听说过史翠珊效应
entry.content:
Nilay Patel 在 The Verge 的 Decoder 播客中采访了 Intuit 首席执行官 Sasan Goodarzi 后说道：

这也不仅仅是游说：2022 年，来自所有 50 个州的总检察长联盟让 Intuit 同意达成 1.41 亿美元的和解协议，要求 Intuit 退还那些有资格免费申请但被重定向到付费产品的低收入美国人。 2023年，FTC发现TurboTax的“免费”营销是故意欺骗，在该机构今年年初赢得上诉后，Intuit被勒令停止这样做。

我问过这个问题，萨桑不同意我的观点，我们就这个问题反复讨论了几分钟。这是解码器；我们一直有这样的交流，我也没有多想。

但后来我收到了 Intuit 首席通讯官里克·海涅曼 (Rick Heineman) 的来信，他称我的提问方式和语气“不恰当”、“过分”和“令人失望”，并要求我们删除整个录音部分。我的意思是，从字面上看，他写了一封很长的电子邮件，结尾是“至少应该删除你采访的最后部分”。

我们 The Verge 不这样做。

奇怪的是，采访中有争议的部分……其实并没有那么有争议吗？如果不是这场完全由 Intuit 自己的通讯主管引发的争议，我可能会听完这一集，甚至可能不会再考虑 Intuit 游说反对国税局和更新税法以消除复杂税收的整个部分。归档。帕特尔当然会提出这个问题。如果他没有这么做，那就太令人震惊了。我认为 Sasan 也介绍了 Intuit 的案例。

但现在这一集已经成为 The Verge 全天的头号新闻，并且肯定比解码器的平均收听率要高得多——听众准备关注 Intuit 反税收改革游说以及他们受到的处罚的部分。因欺骗低收入用户获得他们不需要的付费服务而被罚款。

史翠珊效应并不违反直觉。这是显而易见的人性。我们想要看、听那些被告知不要看或听的事情。

entry.title: 在 Apple Intelligence 推出之际，乔安娜·斯特恩 (Joanna Stern) 采访了克雷格·费德里吉 (Craig Federighi)
entry.content:
乔安娜·斯特恩（Joanna Stern）为《华尔街日报》撰稿（新闻+ ）：

如果您期待人工智能烟花，请为人工智能……烟花做好准备。早在 6 月份，在该公司的年度开发者大会上，高管们就展示了 DIY 表情符号、ChatGPT 集成以及可以回忆起几个月前见过的人的名字的 Siri。苹果甚至还为某些功能投放广告。此版本中没有任何内容。

“这是一个巨大的提升，”苹果公司软件工程高级副总裁克雷格·费德里吉 (Craig Federighi) 在公司总部告诉我。 “你可以把一些东西放在那里，然后让它变得一团糟。苹果的观点更像是，‘让我们努力做好每一件事情，并在准备好后发布它。’”

是的，虽然其他公司纷纷推出生成式人工智能工具， 有时甚至引发争议，但苹果公司却在谨慎行事。费德里吉否认 该公司落后，称其优先考虑隐私和责任。

这是一次非常好的采访，也可以在 YouTube 上观看。

是的，更引人注目、更炫酷的 Apple Intelligence 功能下周不会在 iOS 18.1 和 MacOS 15.1 中发布。但正如斯特恩本人在文章中指出的那样，正在发布的功能确实有用。通知摘要很好——偶尔的错误可能很有趣，但总的来说它很可靠，对于来自同一应用程序或组文本的批量通知特别有帮助。照片中的清理不需要的对象删除器非常棒。我还没有花太多时间尝试这些写作工具，但斯特恩已经尝试过，并且发现它们很有用。这些工具将由普通的非技术 iOS 和 Mac 用户在日常情况下、在他们已经使用的应用程序中使用。苹果对此进行全场媒体报道是有原因的。

★

entry.title: 特朗普：“我需要希特勒那样的将军”
entry.content:
杰弗里·戈德堡（Jeffrey Goldberg）在《大西洋月刊》的一篇必读、必分享的文章中（这是一个礼物链接，应该可以让您通过《大西洋月刊》的订户付费专区，我鼓励您与您认识的每一位潜在选民分享该链接）：

彼得·贝克和苏珊·格拉瑟在他们的书《分裂者：特朗普在白宫》中报道说，特朗普问他当时的幕僚长约翰·凯利，“为什么你不能像德国将军那样？”特朗普曾多次对他认为不忠诚、不听话的军事官员感到沮丧。 （在整个总统任期内，特朗普将军官们称为“我的将军”。）根据贝克和格拉瑟的说法，凯利向特朗普解释说，德国将军“曾三次试图杀死希特勒，几乎成功了”。这一更正并没有让特朗普重新考虑他的观点：“不，不，不，他们完全忠于他，”总统回应道。

本周，我向凯利询问了他们的交流情况。他告诉我，当特朗普提出“德国将军”的话题时，凯利回答道：“‘你是说俾斯麦的将军吗？’”他接着说：“我的意思是，我知道他不知道俾斯麦是谁，或者关于普法战争。我说，‘你是指德皇的将军们吗？你肯定不是指希特勒的将军吧？他说，“是的，是的，希特勒的将军们。”我向他解释说，隆美尔在参与反对希特勒的阴谋后不得不自杀。”凯利告诉我特朗普不认识隆美尔。 [...]

作为总统，特朗普对退休军官的批评表现出极度敏感。有一次，他提议召回现役海军上将威廉·麦克雷文和斯坦利·麦克里斯特尔将军，这两位备受尊敬的特种作战领导人对特朗普持批评态度，这样他们就可以被送上军事法庭。时任国防部长埃斯珀在回忆录中写道，他和米利说服特朗普放弃了该计划。 [...] 当被告知美国军事人员宣誓效忠宪法而不是总统时，特朗普做出了难以置信的回应。

对于真正为此欢呼雀跃的“让美国再次伟大”的底层人士来说，没有希望。然而，特朗普再次取得选举胜利的希望取决于大量保守派，甚至只是保守派选民，他们不认真对待他，没有关注他第一个任期中的所有危险信号和证据，并认为他言不由衷。是的，他说了很多疯狂的话，但当他谈论他想做的事情时，他是认真的。他说他在第一个任期内想做的事情几乎没有什么是他没有做或没有尝试做的。

戈德堡：

2020 年，特朗普曾多次在白宫与国家安全官员就乔治·弗洛伊德抗议活动进行私人对话。据向我描述这次谈话的前官员透露，他说：“中国将军们知道该怎么做。”他指的是 1989 年实施天安门广场大屠杀的中国人民解放军领导人。（普法伊弗否认特朗普曾说过这些话）这么说。）特朗普部署美军对付美国公民的愿望是有据可查的。在弗洛伊德死后令人心碎的社会动荡时期，特朗普询问米利和西点军校毕业生、前步兵军官埃斯珀，军队是否可以射杀抗议者。 “特朗普似乎无法冷静冷静地思考，”埃斯珀在回忆录中写道。 “抗议和暴力让他非常愤怒，以至于他愿意派遣现役部队镇压抗议者。更糟糕的是，他建议我们射杀他们。我想知道他的历史感、礼仪感以及他对宪法的宣誓。”埃斯珀于 2022 年告诉国家公共广播电台，“我们在谈话中谈到了这一点，他坦率地看着米利将军说，‘你不能直接向他们开枪吗？只是朝他们的腿开枪什么的？’”据目击者称，在反对特朗普的愿望时，总统尖叫道：“你们都是他妈的失败者！”

我们的军事领导层有希望再次抵制这样的命令。但特朗普第二届政府中不会有像约翰·凯利或马克·埃斯珀这样的文职领导人。那就自始至终都是阿谀奉承者了。

“他不止一次评论说，‘你知道，希特勒也做了一些好事，’”凯利说，特朗普告诉他。 [...]

凯利先生说这通常会结束谈话。但特朗普偶尔会再次提起这个问题。

entry.summary: 令人震惊的是，真实的故事是一桩丑闻。这让洋基队感到尴尬，但几乎可以肯定朱利安尼犯下了罪行。
entry.content:
上述关于鲁迪·朱利安尼失去财产以支付两名被判诽谤罪的佐治亚州选举官员的文章提到了有关他在 1996 年、1998 年、1999 年担任市长期间洋基队冠军的四枚世界大赛戒指的争议，和2000年。目前的争议是朱利安尼声称他在2018年将戒指给了他傻子儿子安德鲁，因此法庭不再属于他，这一说法非常可疑。

但鲁迪最初是如何得到它们的呢？据普遍报道，这些戒指是洋基队在每次获胜后送给他担任纽约市长的礼物。这是美联社今天的一份报告，只是掩盖了它们的出处。

令人震惊的是，真实的故事是一桩丑闻。这让洋基队感到尴尬，但朱利安尼几乎可以肯定是犯罪。他最初收到这枚戒指的事似乎直到 2007 年他不幸竞选总统期间才被公众所知，当时他戴着其中一枚戒指参加竞选。 2007 年 5 月，乡村之声记者韦恩·巴雷特 (Wayne Barrett) 在标题为“洋基队的清洁工”的 6,000 字专题中揭露了整个肮脏的传奇故事：

人们看到朱利安尼在竞选活动中戴着一枚世界职业棒球大赛戒指，这是我们从来不知道他拥有的宝贵奖品。事实上，洋基队告诉《声音》，他有四枚戒指，在他担任市长期间洋基队赢得的每一个世界冠军都一枚戒指。对过去十年中赢得系列赛冠军的其他城市的语音通话表明，朱利安尼是唯一一位拥有戒指的市长，更不用说四枚戒指了。如果听起来很无辜，请等待价格标签。这些肯定不是运河街立方氧化锆的仿制品。

1996 年、1998 年、1999 年和 2000 年的钻石金戒指上都刻有朱利安尼的名字，纪念品和棒球专家表示，这些戒指的总价值至少为 20 万美元。洋基队表示，朱利安尼确实为他的戒指付了钱——但只花了 16,000 美元，而且是在他卸任多年之后。任何人花钱购买戒指就像市长得到一枚戒指一样不寻常，因为洋基队和任何其他最近的冠军都没有向几乎任何人出售过戒指。然而，这笔微薄的付款还不到戒指重置价值的一半，这只是市场价格的一小部分，尤其是考虑到朱利安尼名字的附加值。

更令人不安的是，朱利安尼收到戒指的行为可能严重违法，仍可能受到起诉。纽约官员被禁止接受任何与该市做生意的人赠送的价值超过 50 美元的礼物，在朱利安尼的领导下，这项法规对其他人严厉执行。例如，他的政府强迫一位消防局局长退休，没收 93,105 美元的工资，并支付 6,000 美元的罚款，因为他从城市供应商那里拿走了两场百老汇演出的门票和一周免费的滑雪公寓。该市的利益冲突委员会 (COIB) 也将礼物规则应用于折扣，除非更便宜的价格“普遍适用于所有政府雇员”。

不用说，任何人都无法以任何价格购买世界大赛戒指。

四名消息人士（两名来自制造商，两名来自市政厅）告诉《声音》，一枚刻有朱利安尼名字的戒指是在 1996 年或 1997 年初制作的。市政厅消息人士还记得他当时收到了这枚戒指。此外，其中一位消息人士以及另外两名前朱利安尼工作人员表示，市长直到很久以后才拥有另外三枚戒指。这些助手们最清楚的回忆是，他在 2001 年任期即将结束时，一揽子获得了这些戒指，当时他的政府与洋基队达成了多项重要交易。虽然洋基队无法解释为什么他一年内支付三枚戒指，一年后支付 1996 年的戒指，但消息来源引用的年表表明了这一点。他为一起收到的三件付了钱，后来又想起为他很久以前收到的那件付了钱。他购买 1996 年戒指的价格比购买其他戒指少了 2,000 美元——这再次表明，这次著名的拍卖与市场因素有多么脱节，因为许多戒指专家认为，结束了近两年洋基干旱的 1996 年戒指是最有价值的。四者中最有价值的。

我在这里引用了巴雷特的报道中的很多内容，但还有更多，所有这些都非常扭曲——一个大规模贪污和小额诈骗的肮脏故事。这是调查报道的一个非凡例子。读完这本书，你会嘲笑现在名誉扫地的朱利安尼的牺牲。巴雷特的报告得出结论：

那些熟悉朱利安尼的人说，当他认为自己恋爱时，他就放弃了所有可接受的行为规则。但他和他的团队的故事不仅仅是一个令人不安的迷恋和自我陶醉的传奇。这是一个关于他将成为什么样的总统的实物教训，是一扇了解他愿意为特殊利益服务的窗口，模糊了通常区分个人和公共生活的所有界限。他并不是很认同洋基队。他所服务的是他自己。

事实证明，我们最终得到了这样的总统，并且可能会再次得到他。只是他的名字不叫朱利安尼。

凯特琳·波兰兹 (Katelyn Polantz)，CNN 报道：

曼哈顿联邦法院法官刘易斯·利曼 (Lewis Liman) 表示，朱利安尼必须在 7 天内将他在该房产中的权益移交给她们，交给她们将控制的接管机构。法官对奢侈品的移交令既迅速又简单，但顶层公寓的控制权将被转移，以便弗里曼和莫斯可以出售它，可能售价数百万美元。

法官裁定，这些在 2020 年大选后计票佐治亚州选票的女性还将有权获得约 200 万美元的法律费用，朱利安尼称特朗普竞选团队仍欠他。

除了特朗普的竞选费用和纽约公寓之外，朱利安尼还必须交出多件手表收藏，其中包括 2001 年 9 月 11 日袭击事件后欧洲总统送给他的手表；乔·迪马吉奥签名球衣和其他体育纪念品；以及好莱坞明星劳伦·白考尔 (Lauren Bacall) 曾经拥有的一辆 1980 款奔驰。此外，法官还命令朱利安尼交出他的电视机、家具和珠宝。

利曼尚未决定朱利安尼是否能够保留他也拥有的佛罗里达州棕榈滩公寓，或他拥有的四枚纽约洋基队世界职业棒球大赛戒指，朱利安尼的儿子声称这是他父亲送给他的。

唐纳德·特朗普拥有众多超能力。其中之一是，迄今为止，他因以他的名义犯下的罪行几乎没有遭受任何后果。特朗普集团首席财务官艾伦·韦塞尔伯格 (Allen Weisselberg) 不仅在赖克斯岛度过了一段艰难的时光，而且还度过了一段艰难的时光。前白宫官员彼得·纳瓦罗？监狱。史蒂夫·班农？监狱。特朗普的私人律师迈克尔科恩？监狱。这样的例子不胜枚举。

现在，由于他代表特朗普试图推翻2020年大选结果，鲁迪·朱利安尼似乎陷入了贫困。确实如此。整个“美国市长”的伎俩是不劳而获的，但他有。他拥有尊重和财富。现在他连电视都他妈的没有了。他的一生都被耻辱地浪费在执行唐纳德·特朗普的命令上，此时特朗普肯定不会接朱利安尼的电话，更不用说真正帮助他了。

entry.title: 欧盟考虑将埃隆·马斯克其他公司的收入纳入 X 公司罚款计算中
entry.content:
Gian Volpicelli 和 Samuel Stolton，彭博社报道* ：

根据欧盟《数字服务法案》，如果在线平台未能解决非法内容和虚假信息或未能遵守透明度规则，欧盟可对其处以高达其全球年收入 6% 的罚款。知情人士表示，监管机构正在考虑除了社交网络产生的收入之外，是否还应将 SpaceX、Neuralink、xAI 和 Boring Company 的销售收入计算在内，以确定对 X 的潜在罚款。信息不公开。 [...]

X是一家由马斯克单独控制的私人公司。知情人士称，在考虑其他公司的收入时，该委员会本质上是在权衡马斯克本人是否应被视为罚款实体，而不是 X 本身。一位知情人士表示，特斯拉公司的销售额将不受此计算，因为该公司是公开交易的，不受马斯克完全控制。知情人士称，该委员会尚未决定是否对 X 进行处罚，任何潜在罚款的数额仍在讨论中。

如果 X 被分拆为一家更大的原始公司的子公司，那是一回事，特别是为了减少任何潜在的基于收入的处罚的规模。比如说，如果苹果突然决定将“iOS”拆分为一家独立公司，将软件授权给苹果以安装在 iPhone 上。但我们都知道 X 不是这样的。 X 是 Twitter，这是一家上市公司，马斯克没有持有任何股份，后来被他收购并私有化。

如果欧盟真的决定将 SpaceX 和马斯克的其他公司的收入纳入计算对 X 的处罚中，那么它实际上会玩一种单方面的卡尔文球游戏，规则只是在执行过程中凭空捏造出来的。 （除了“真正的”卡尔文博尔，双方都可以根据自己的需要改变规则。）他们选择全球收入的百分比作为潜在处罚的基础。 X Corp 的收入少得令人尴尬（而且还在不断减少），这并不是马斯克的错。等等，实际上，那是他的错。他买了一家糟糕的企业，结果让它变得更糟。 X公司在财务上陷入困境意味着他可以用自己的零钱支付任何潜在的基于收入的罚款，这并不是他的错。

诚实的问题：有人可以向我解释委员会对大胆的使用吗？在新闻稿的前265个单词中，其中66个是大胆的，遍布13个不同的跨度。他们似乎使用大胆的方式，特朗普在他的推文中大写字眼的方式：不加区别。我发现这很分散注意力，就像试图阅读赎金信一样。不仅是这个新闻稿，他们一直都这样做。

entry.title: DHH反对Passkeys
entry.content:
大卫·海尼耶尔·汉森（David Heinemeier Hansson）：

是的，密码有问题。如果您在没有密码管理器的情况下使用它们，则很可能会在多个服务中重复使用它们，如果您这样做，它只需使用一项具有糟糕密码练习的服务（例如将它们存储在纯文本中，而不是用某些东西将它们放置像bcrypt）一样，违规将意味着黑客可能可以访问您所有其他服务。

但是，仅仅因为我们有一个真正的问题，并不意味着所有提出的解决方案实际上都会变得更好。目前，我看不出Passkey的实际上是如何更好的，更糟糕​​的是，会变得更好。除非您接受所有密码都应与一个计算生态系统相关的想法，从而使使用替代计算机很难。 [...]

最重要的是，我很失望地报告说，Passkeys似乎不值得实施的复杂性（这是实质性的！），也不值得用户体验的复杂性和陷入困境。因此，我们坚持密码和电子邮件。鼓励选择加入2FA和密码管理器，但不需要它们。

Passkeys似乎很有希望，但并非所有良好的意愿都带来了良好的解决方案。

我对Passkeys没有强烈的感受，但是我对他们隐约不安。不使用适当的密码管理器，例如带有iCloud键链或1Password的Apple密码，无法使用Passkeys。但是，如果您使用的是正确的密码管理器，则密码应该是唯一的和随机的，并且应该方便地访问2FA代码。那么，只有已经使用良好密码管理器的人才能使用Passkeys，这有什么意义？也许的想法是，太多的用户无法从使用他们记住的密码的危险习惯中汲取灵感，而Passkeys是一种破坏这种习惯的方式，因为他们无法记住。

另外，我真的不喜欢用电子邮件“魔术链接”替换密码的做法。从我的钥匙串中自动填写密码，立即发生；从电子邮件中获得魔术链接有时可能需要几分钟，即使在最快的情况下，它也远不及即时。用较慢的东西替换非常快的东西 - 密码自动填充只是一个可怕的主意。对于真正喜欢电子邮件魔术链接的人来说，这是一个可以选择的选择，但这不应该是默认值，当然，它当然也不是登录帐户的唯一方法。

entry.summary: 要问的问题是：“这是用户想要和期望的吗？”有时候真的很简单。我不确定是否值得问：“这是由VC支持的社交媒体应用程序制造商想要的吗？”
entry.content:
凯文·罗斯（Kevin Roose）上周为《纽约时报》（New York Times）写了一篇专栏，标题为“ 苹果只是杀死了社交应用程序吗？ ”， 杰森·斯内尔（Jason Snell）打趣说：“很少有一个故事比挑衅的标题更糟，但这是一个管理的。”罗斯（Roose）的要旨认为，苹果在iOS 18中对联系共享的新细粒度控制有争议。罗斯自己写道：

多年来，联系人共享在iOS设备上的工作方式是，应用程序可以触发称为“数据访问提示的消息”的消息，要求访问用户的联系人。

如果用户同意，应用程序开发人员将获得该用户通讯簿中所有联系人的列表，以及存储在用户联系卡中的其他信息，例如电话号码和电子邮件地址。然后，应用程序开发人员可以使用该信息来构建用户的社交图，或建议其他帐户供用户遵循。

但是，在iOS 18中，同意向应用程序访问其联系人的用户显示了第二个消息，使他们可以选择要共享的联系人。用户可以选择一个接一个选择，而不是一一选择共享少数联系人，而不是分叉整个通讯录。

苹果对这些更改的陈述理由很简单：不应强迫用户做出全有或全无的选择。许多用户的iPhone上有数百或数千个联系人，其中包括他们不希望共享的一些联系人。 （一名治疗师、一名前任、以及他们 2013 年在酒吧随机遇到的一个人。）多年来，iOS 一直允许用户让应用程序有选择地访问他们的照片；同一原则不应该适用于他们的联系人吗？

显而易见的答案是肯定的，同样的原则当然应该适用于联系人。但是，罗斯将这一变化呈现为有争议和反竞争性的，这是基于新兴的社交网络在过去的15年中，利用这些全部或全天候访问用户的联系来建立他们的社交图，并指出这一点，并指出了这一点。苹果自己的第一方应用程序（例如消息和邮件）并未受到这些限制。

尼克·海尔（Nick Heer）对罗斯（Roose）在像素嫉妒的文章中写了一个出色的回应 - “ 我不在乎障碍对令人毛骨悚然的成长黑客技巧” - 其中全部值得您全部关注，但是这段段落总结了我的第一个想法：

令人惊讶的不是苹果允许更精细的联系人访问，而是该公司花了这么长时间才这样做。开发人员大小的人滥用了此功能。 Facebook 无意中获取了150 万用户的联系人列表，也有意无意地获取了数百万用户的联系人列表，这些数据用于为其“您可能认识的人”功能提供信息。 LinkedIn是令人毛骨悚然的，基本上是同一件事。 Clubhouse 借用了 TBH 的剧本，在你使用该应用程序之前就收集联系人信息。这对于暴露许多人希望隐藏的隐藏联系产生了真正的影响。

我的另一个想法是，新的限制不可避免地会引起那些滥用新限制资源的人的不满。污染者对新规定感到不满，这些规定迫使他们停止向河流和湖泊倾倒化学物质，或将其泵入空气中。一个世纪前，煤矿和工厂对童工法的不满（有些人今天仍然对它们感到不满）。如果 iOS 在 2007 年首次推出时，每个联系人的共享控制与今天的 iOS 18 中的完全一样，那么没有人会抱怨这是错误或不公平的。 1但是，苹果仅添加这些控件才使其与众不同。他们不仅给予用户以前没有的控制权，而且还从那些寻求利用（正如希尔恰当地描述的）一种令人毛骨悚然的增长黑客技术的公司手中夺走了一些东西。这个心理学很大，这种心理学解释了为什么向少数群体赋予社会平等的原因，这是对多数群体中的某些人的感觉，即胸怀小而偏执的人，例如失去特权和地位降级。 2

至于卢斯的论点，即苹果自己的应用程序不受这些地址簿限制的限制甚至有些争议：

一些开发人员还指出，iOS 18更改不适用于苹果自己的服务。例如，iMessage 无需像 WhatsApp、Signal、微信和其他第三方消息应用程序那样请求访问用户的联系人权限。他们认为这是从根本上进行反竞争的 - 一个明确的例子是反托拉斯监管机构在其他情况下反对的自我挑战。

第一方成为第一方战利品。考虑一部没有使用户的完整地址簿可用于内置电话通话和消息传递应用程序的手机是荒谬的。所有手机在此类核心应用程序之间均提供类似的系统级集成。但是，特别是对于苹果而言，广泛而深厚的整合是公司的作案手法。人们选择使用Apple平台是因为集成而选择使用Apple平台。正如我上个月在“ iOS大陆漂移扩大”中写的那样：

Safari不仅是恰好是Apple的网络浏览器。这是Apple设计的Web浏览器，可在iOS上执行iOS方法（以及MacOS上的Macintosh方法）。如果作为用户，您以Apple的方式进行操作 - 拥有多个Apple设备，使用iCloud进行同步，将Safari用作网络浏览器 - 您将获得集成的体验，并在设备上访问设备B上的选项卡上打开的选项卡，共享所有设备之间的浏览历史记录和书签，以及对系统范围服务和功能的支持。苹果公司在工厂新鲜iPhone上的默认应用程序旨在合作并始终如一地展示自己。这并不是说没有人应该使用苹果本身替代品的第三方应用程序。当然不是。当然，几乎每个大胆火球的读者都使用一个或多个是苹果替代品的第三方应用程序。我用了几个。但是，内置的Apple应用程序共同构成了Apple定义的体验。这些确实是大多数非专家用户应该使用的应用程序。以及最好的第三方替代方案，例如梦幻般的（日历），卡德霍普（Cardhop （Contacts）， Overcast （播客）和熊（注释）），无缝地符合整个Apple体验。他们是与第一方体验融为一体的第三方应用程序。

CardHop是一个特别恰当的例子，因为其全部目的是作为系统联系人应用程序的完整替代方法。如果它需要每个联系人的每个条目权限，它就无法做到这一点，因此它要求用户提供完整的地址簿读/写访问权限，Cardhop 用户授予该访问权限，因为，呃，该应用程序的全部要点是这是一本完整的地址簿。新的社交媒体网络不是地址簿——用户都知道这一点。

此外，即使抛开第一方应用程序必然具有第三方应用程序不具备的某些优势（否则就没有区别）这一事实，来自同一开发者的应用程序也拥有通过应用程序组共享数据和资源的广泛权限。 Gmail 可以与 Google 日历对话，而 Google 日历可以完全访问 Gmail 的地址簿。邮件和Apple邮件的“从根本上是反竞争”的“根本上是反竞争的”，可以完全访问您的联系人地址簿，而不是通过在Instagram的现有帐户和社交图上启动线程来启动线程。如果它不公平，那也只是像一般生活不公平一样不公平。

要问的问题是：“这是用户想要和期望的吗？”有时候真的很简单。我不确定是否值得问：“这是由VC支持的社交媒体应用程序制造商想要的吗？”

entry.title: 互联网存档被黑客入侵，数据泄露影响3100万用户
entry.content:
劳伦斯·艾布拉姆斯（Lawrence Abrams），易怒计算机报告：

Internet档案馆的“ Wayback Machine”遭受了数据泄露，因为威胁性演员损害了该网站并偷走了包含3100万个唯一记录的用户身份验证数据库。周三下午，archive.org 的访问者开始看到黑客创建的 JavaScript 警报，指出互联网档案馆遭到破坏后，有关此次泄露的消息开始流传。

“您是否曾经感觉像互联网档案库在棍子上运行，并且不断遇到灾难性安全漏洞的边缘？它就这样发生了。在 HIBP 上看到 3100 万人！”受感染的 archive.org 网站上显示的 JavaScript 警报中写道。

文本“ HIBP”是指由Troy Hunt创建的数据泄露通知服务，威胁参与者通常会与他们共享被盗的数据以添加到该服务中。

亨特告诉BleepingComputer，威胁参与者九天前共享了Internet存档的身份验证数据库，它是一个名为“ IA_USERS.SQL”的6.4GB SQL文件。该数据库包含注册会员的身份验证信息，包括他们的电子邮件地址、屏幕名称、密码更改时间戳、Bcrypt 哈希密码和其他内部数据。

似乎还不足以使互联网档案库（看似无法替代的网络信号资源）为糟糕的一周 - 他们也受到了DDOS攻击。杰森·斯科特（Jason Scott），互联网档案馆的档案管理员，马斯托登（Mastodon ）：

有人在互联网存档，所以我们已经停了几个小时了。根据他们的推特，他们这样做只是为了这样做。只是因为他们可以。没有声明，没有想法，没有要求。

Moom 4 is only available directly from Many Tricks; it is not available on the Mac App Store.如果是我们的选择，它也会出现在 Mac App Store 中，但这不是我们的选择。

为什么它不在 Mac App Store 中？因为Mac App Store不允许未沙盒化的应用程序。 And Moom 4 cannot be sandboxed, as its use of the Accessibility API makes that impossible. So how was Moom 3, which also uses the Accessibility API, on the Mac App Store? If Apple ever changes the rules, we will submit Moom 4 for Mac App Store review, but until/unless those rules change, you can only get Moom 4 directly from us.

What a perfect example of the shortcomings of the Mac App Store. 我将首先链接到 The Verge 的“ Meta Connect 2024 上宣布的一切”综述，因为 Meta 尚未在 YouTube 上发布今天的主题演讲；我发现的最好的就是这段直播录音，从 43 分 20 秒左右开始。我现场观看了大部分主题演讲，发现它很吸引人。只有 45 分钟长——部分原因是信息密集，部分原因是马克·扎克伯格亲自主持了整个活动。他最近看起来很舒服、自信、自然。没有什么比一堆副总裁更能拖慢台上主题演讲的节奏了。 There was clearly no political infighting at Meta for stage time in this keynote.基调是扎克的，因此，它有力而轻快。

In terms of actual products that will actually ship, Meta announced the $300 Quest 3S .这比 Vision Pro 的价格低了整整一个数量级。 Vision Pro might be more than 10× more capable than Quest 3S, but I'm not sure it's 10× better for just playing games and watching movies, which might be the only things people want to do with headsets at the moment. They also launched a 7,500-unit limited edition of their $430 actually-somewhat-popular Ray-Ban Wayfarer “smart” glasses made with translucent plastic, iMac-style.自从有人制造“看看内部”消费设备以来已经有一段时间了。这很有趣，也有点古怪。

最重要的展示是 Orion，一款透明 AR 眼镜的工作原型。 Meta 本身将它们描述为“开发套件”，但它们不仅无法购买，而且不可用，就这样。它们是 Meta 自己的开发人员的内部原型，而不是外部开发人员。对于演示来说，它们确实看起来很有趣，而且我从门洛帕克现场的抖动记者那里听说，使用它们确实很引人注目。毫无疑问，实际的眼镜是 AR 的外形因素。

今天，The Verge 的亚历克斯·希思 (Alex Heath) 在他关于猎户座的文章中这样开头：

They look almost like a normal pair of glasses.

这将“几乎”的含义延伸到了极限。 I'd say they look vaguely kinda-sorta like a pair of normal glasses.镜框（超级粗）和镜片（厚，棱柱形，有时发光）都很引人注目。 They look orthopedic, like glasses intended to aid people whose vision is so low they're legally blind.确实，Meta 的雷朋 Wayfarers 与普通 Wayfarers 几乎没有什么区别。猎户座根本不是那样的。如果您带着这些设备出现在公共场合（您不能这样做，因为它们是内部原型），每个人都会注意到您戴着某种科技眼镜，或者可能会认为您走出电影院时没有归还 3D风镜。但是：如果你愿意的话，你可以在公共场合佩戴它们，而且与在公共场合佩戴 VR 耳机不同，你看起来只是一个书呆子， 而不是一个混蛋。他们很接近某事。但距离真正重要的东西有多近，尤其是在价格方面，是值得商榷的。 From Heath's report:

正如 Meta 的高管复述的那样，搁置 Orion 的决定主要是因为该设备的制造成本天文数字，每台大约为 10,000 美元。大部分成本是由于可靠地制造碳化硅透镜非常困难且昂贵。当开始设计 Orion 时，Meta 预计这种材料将在整个行业中得到更广泛的应用，从而变得更便宜，但这一情况并没有发生。

“你无法想象产量有多么可怕，”Meta 首席技术官 Andrew Bosworth 谈到镜头时说道。相反，该公司转而生产约 1,000 副 Orion 眼镜，用于内部开发和外部演示。

Snap 最近推出了他们的新款 Spectacles ，他们以每年 1,200 美元的价格出租而不是出售。 Snap 的眼镜非常粗壮，与 Orion 相比显得不那么显眼。但将 AR 眼镜推向市场的竞赛显然已经开始。

另请参阅： Heath 对扎克伯格的 Decoder 采访。

第二天附录：今天早上我醒来时，脑子里浮现出以下竞争性的来回：

  1. Facebook 推出了 VR 耳机和软件平台，非常强调“虚拟宇宙”，因此他们将公司重新命名为 Meta。
  2. 相比之下，苹果公司宣布并在 7 个月后发布了 Vision Pro，它传达了两个信息：（a）“元宇宙”这个东西太愚蠢了，他们甚至不会使用这个术语； (b) 极其卓越的分辨率和体验质量。然而，消费者的反应却并不令人印象深刻。
  3. Meta 放弃了“metaverse”这个词，并预览了 Orion，有效地宣称他们认为 VR 耳机是错误的东西，以创建定义个人计算领域下一个突破性变革的产品。 AR glasses, not VR headsets, are the goal.

这需要大量的来回讨论，这使得新设备前沿的早期阶段令人兴奋且高度不确定。大胆的想法被尝试过，但大多数都以死胡同而告终。与过去 20 年我们在笔记本电脑方面的发展情况或近年来我们在手机方面似乎达到的顶峰进行比较和对比。

entry.summary: 对于一款高级壁纸应用来说，每年 50 美元的价格是完全合理的。但面板并不是一款高级应用程序。
entry.content:
MKBHD 的一次失误。 Criticism of the app is on two separate levels, but they're being conflated. 1级：应用程序不好。第 2 级：付费壁纸应用程序？ — LOL, wallpapers are free on Reddit .第二种形式的批评——甚至不应该存在付费壁纸应用程序——令人烦恼和沮丧，并说明有多少人认为原创艺术不值得付费。但这也说明了布朗利受众的广泛性，我认为他们更注重技术而不是设计。斯科特·史密斯在《乳齿象》中观察到：

It's really interesting to compare the reaction from the indie iOS community of @Iconfactory 's Wallaroo to the mainstream tech community's reaction to @mkbhd 's Panels.我知道它们无论如何都不一样，但这表明主流科技圈中有多少人仍然对购买艺术品感到惊讶。

就是这样，事情就是这样。在某种程度上，贪图小气的观点可以被忽略。如果有人的论点是所有壁纸都应该免费，那么这并不是批评付费壁纸应用程序/服务的有效起点。

问题是，Panels 不是一个好的应用程序：

  • 第一次在 iPhone 上运行时，它就崩溃了。

  • UI 又大又圆，虽然它在 iOS和Android上看起来几乎相同（这可能就是它如此粗糙的原因），但它在这两个平台上看起来都是原生的。 It looks and feels more like the interface to a game than an app.如果说有什么不同的话，那就是它的外观和感觉比 iOS 更偏向 Android 风格，哪怕只是因为“在任何地方看起来都不是原生的”更像是 Android 风格。如果 Brownlee 对这款应用程序的外观和感觉感到不满意，这在很大程度上（更多）解释了他为何愿意每天花大量时间驾驶 Android 手机。

  • 完全主观，但我不认为壁纸本身很好。我的意思是不像他们中的任何一个。它们感觉像是用户生成的内容，而不是像布朗利这样值得信赖的时尚引领者策划的专业内容。

  • 该应用程序的隐私报告卡很糟糕，包括使用您的一般位置进行跟踪，并且在 iOS 上会弹出“要求应用程序不要跟踪”对话框。 Android 上的情况更糟。不是溢价。 （Panels 不要求 GPS 位置访问，但它使用您的 IP 地址进行跟踪，Apple 将其归类为“位置”。Apple 应该在 App Store 隐私报告卡中澄清这一区别 - 要求 GPS 与全部都是基于 IP 的地理定位——但对于应用程序来说这看起来很糟糕。）

  • “SD”（1080p）壁纸可以从一些创作者那里免费下载，但需要观看一两分钟的视频广告。不是溢价。

  • 订阅费用为 50 美元/年或 12 美元/月（每年 144 美元！）——至少可以说，这是溢价。 （ Wallaroo是一个更好的应用程序，主观上来说，它有更好的壁纸，费用为 20 美元/年或 2 美元/月。）

对于一款高级壁纸应用来说，每年 50 美元的价格是完全合理的。 But Panels isn't a premium app .高级应用程序不会要求跨应用程序跟踪您。高级应用程序不会让您观看广告来获取其免费内容。 Premium apps look and feel native to their platforms.高级应用程序没有粗略的隐私报告卡。 As it stands, Panels is incongruous and incoherent.

entry.summary: 除了每年新机型背面不断增加的相机镜头块或“用 iPhone 拍摄”广告活动之外，还有什么比这更能证明相机对 iPhone 的独特重要性呢？专用的硬件按钮？
entry.content:
史蒂夫·乔布斯 (Steve Jobs) 2007 年推出初代 iPhone 时，众多令人难忘的时刻之一就是这张幻灯片，展示了当时市场上四款领先的智能手机。乔布斯解释道：

现在，为什么我们需要革命性的用户界面？这是四部智能手机，对吗？摩托罗拉 Q、黑莓、Palm Treo、诺基亚 E62——这些都是常见的嫌疑人。而且，他们的用户界面有什么问题？嗯，他们的问题确实是在倒数 40 名中。就是这个东西就在那里。他们都有这些键盘，无论您是否需要它们都在那里。它们都具有固定在塑料中的控制按钮，并且对于每种应用程序都是相同的。嗯，每个应用程序都需要一个稍微不同的用户界面，一组稍微优化的按钮，只是为了它。

如果六个月后你想到一个好主意，会发生什么？你不能到处跑，给这些东西添加一个按钮。他们已经发货了。那你怎么办？它不起作用，因为按钮和控件无法更改。 They can't change for each application, and they can't change down the road if you think of another great idea you want to add to this product.

那么，你如何解决这个问题呢？唔。事实证明，我们已经解决了这个问题。 20年前我们用计算机解决了这个问题。我们用位图屏幕解决了这个问题，它可以显示我们想要的任何内容。放置任何用户界面。还有指点设备。我们用鼠标解决了这个问题。我们解决了这个问题。那么我们如何将其应用到移动设备上呢？我们要做的就是去掉所有这些按钮，只制作一个巨大的屏幕。一个巨大的屏幕。

当时，最激进的做法似乎是放弃硬件QWERTY键盘，转而在软件中实现触摸屏键盘。微软时任首席执行官史蒂夫·鲍尔默 (Steve Ballmer)在一段臭名昭著的视频中，在被问及看到 iPhone 的反应后，他哈哈大笑：“500 美元？全额补贴，有计划吗？ I said, that is the most expensive phone in the world, and it doesn't appeal to business customers because it doesn't have a keyboard, which makes it not a very good email machine.”

当然，苹果并没有取消所有按钮。但他们保留的按钮都是为了系统、设备，而不是为了任何特定的应用：电源、音量、静音开关（奇怪的是，几乎没有竞争对手复制），以及正面唯一的按钮：Home 。 1 That's it.

When Apple's competitors stopped laughing at the iPhone and started copying it, they got rid of their hardware keyboards — theretofore the primary signifier differentiating a “smartphone” from a regular phone — but they couldn't bring themselves to eliminate the not one but two dedicated在他们缺乏想象力的头脑中，硬件按钮是使任何手机成为电话所固有的：绿色的“通话”按钮和红色的“挂断”按钮。 Android 手机有那些红色/绿色按钮。 The BlackBerry Storm had them too.除了 iPhone 之外的所有手机都有它们。 Until they caught up and realized those buttons were obviated too.

The thinking might have been rooted in the very name of the devices.当然，所有手机——哑巴手机、黑莓风格的硬件键盘手机、iPhone 风格的触摸屏手机——都应该有电话按钮。我怀疑他们非常深入地思考了苹果如何大胆地放弃硬件键盘而采用全触摸屏设计，但他们认为苹果只是通过回避绿色/红色硬件呼叫按钮将极简主义发挥到了极致。 No matter how many other things they do, they're phones first — it's right there in their name!

但 iPhone 从来都不是真正的电话。 On the iPhone, the Phone was always just another app.毫无疑问，这是一个特殊的应用程序。默认放置在主屏幕底部的 Dock 中。 Special background privileges within an otherwise highly constrained OS where most apps effectively quit when you'd go back to the Home Screen.来电瞬间占据了整个屏幕。乔布斯在介绍中花了很多时间演示电话应用程序，其中包括可视语音邮件，这是一项真正的突破性功能，需要 AT&T/Cingular 在后端进行合作。 2

But, still, the Phone part of iPhone was then and remains now just an app.如果将 iPhone 与 iPod Touch 进​​行比较，iPhone 硬件上没有任何东西表明它比 iPod Touch 更像是一款手机，而 iPod Touch 不仅不是手机，甚至不提供蜂窝网络。当然，没有按钮。没有伸出的天线。 No carrier logo on the device. Look at a modern iPhone and there's really only one function whose purpose is clearly visible from a conspicuous hardware protrusion: the camera lenses.五年前，在我对 iPhone 11 的评测中，我写道：“几周前，在我的播客上，推测今年新款 iPhone 的主打功能时，我说“iCamera”会更合适。 name than 'iPhone'.”

除了每年新机型背面不断增加的相机镜头块，或者“ Shot on iPhone ”广告活动——运行时间最长（并且仍在进行中）之外，还有什么比这更能证明相机对 iPhone 的独特重要性呢？ ) campaign in Apple's history?专用的硬件按钮？

相机控制

简单的看法是，苹果已经耗尽了硬件创意，现在每年只在 iPhone 上添加一个新按钮——去年是“操作”按钮，今年是“相机控制”，也许明年他们最终会添加那些绿色/红色的电话按钮。但这低估了苹果在 iPhone 第 18 次年度硬件迭代中添加专用于单个应用程序的硬件按钮的激进程度。

我指的是一般意义上的应用程序，而不仅仅是应用程序意义上的应用程序。 By default, of course, pressing Camera Control launches the iOS Camera app, 3 but while setting up any new iPhone 16, Apple's own onboarding screen describes its purpose as launching “a camera app”, with a lowercase c .任何采用新 API 和指南的第三方应用程序都可以充当由 Camera Control 启动（并且一旦启动后进行控制）的相机应用程序。 （不过，我将默认撰写有关使用系统相机应用程序的文章。）

苹果似乎从未将相机控制称为“按钮”，但它确实是一个按钮。你可以看到它按下去，即使在设备关闭时它也会发出咔嗒声（不像以前的 iPhone 上的触觉 Touch ID Home 按钮和老旧的 iPhone SE）。 But it isn't only a button.您可以将其视为两个物理控件合二为一：一个微型触觉滑块（就像只有一个轴的触控板）和一个实际单击的按钮。

When the Camera app is not already in shoot mode (whether your iPhone is on the Lock Screen or if another app is active — or even if you're doing something else inside the Camera app other than shooting, like, say, reviewing existing photos ）：

  • 完全单击相机控制按钮可启动相机应用程序（如有必要）并使您进入拍摄模式。
  • A light press triggers nothing, nor offers any haptic feedback.仅当您在相机应用程序中准备拍摄时，轻按才会执行某些操作。

当相机应用程序处于活动状态并准备拍摄时：

  • 完全单击“相机控制”按钮可拍摄照片或启动视频，具体取决于您当前的模式。 （如果您处于静态照片模式，单击并按住“相机控制”将启动视频，就像按住屏幕上的快门按钮一样。）
  • 轻按“相机控制”会打开一个叠加层，您可以通过从左向右滑动手指（触控板式）来调整当前设置模式。
  • 轻按相机控制上的两次即可更改覆盖层，以选择要调整的设置。选项包括：曝光、深度（f-stop）、变焦、相机、风格、色调。

Just writing that all out makes it sound complicated, and it is a bit complex. (Here's Apple's own illustrated guide to using Camera Control .) Cameras are complex. But if you just mash it down, it takes a picture.相机控制就像相机应用程序本身的缩影。 Just want to point and shoot?简单的。想要摆弄 f-stops 和风格吗？有一个深思熟虑的用户界面可以做到这一点。 In the early years of iPhone, Apple's Camera app was truly point-and-shoot simplistic .拍摄界面只有几个按钮：快门、照片/视频切换、闪光灯控制以及切换到前置摄像头的切换。最初的 iPhone 和 iPhone 3G 甚至不支持视频，前置摄像头直到 iPhone 4 才出现。那些旧 iPhone 的摄像头硬件很简单，应用程序也体现了这种简单性。

苹果的现代相机硬件已经变得非常复杂，相机应用程序也是如此。但如果您只想拍摄取景器中看到的内容，那就一如既往的简单。 Pinch to zoom, tap to focus, press the shutter button to shoot.但还有许多其他控件和选项，随时可用并智能地呈现给那些需要它们的人，而那些不需要它们的人很容易忽略。苹果的相机应用程序是世界上最好的、设计最好的软件之一。可以说，它也是世界上被复制最多的界面。你很难找到一款高级 Android 手机，其内置相机应用程序看起来不像苹果的，通常甚至连文本标签的黄色强调色都没有。

使用几台 iPhone 16 评测设备一周多后，我对相机控制的总结是，需要一段时间才能习惯——我觉得我还在习惯它——但它已经感觉像是我不想要的东西没有。这是一个好主意，也是一个大胆的主意。正如我上面强调的，只有在第 18 次硬件修订版中，苹果才添加了专用于单个应用程序的硬件控制。我不希望苹果再次这样做。我确实希望苹果的竞争对手会无耻地模仿相机控制。

不过，一开始我对摄像机控制的物理位置感到沮丧。作为一名自 20 世纪 90 年代末以来一直使用专用相机进行拍摄的业余摄影师，我的右手食指预计快门按钮位于右上角附近。但Camera Control 的中心距离角点为2 英寸（5 厘米）。 I'll never stop wishing for it to be closer to the corner, but after a week I've grown acclimated to its actual placement. And I get it.我已经足够大了，我可以用宽屏方向拍摄所有视频和大部分照片。 But social media today is dominated by tallscreen video. As Apple's Piyush Pratik explained during last week's keynote , Camera Control is designed to be used in both wide (landscape) and tall (portrait) orientations. Moving it more toward the corner, where my finger wants it to be, would make it better for shooting widescreen, but would make it downright precarious to hold the iPhone while shooting tall. I hate to admit it but I think Apple got the placement right.射击高屏非常受欢迎。 And, after just a week, my index finger is getting more and more accustomed to its placement. It might prove to be a bit of a reach for people with small hands, though.

I've also been a bit frustrated by using Camera Control to launch Camera while my iPhone is locked. With the default settings, when your iPhone is unlocked, or locked but with the screen awake, a single click of Camera Control takes you right to shooting mode in the Camera app. That sounds obvious, and it is. But, when your iPhone is locked and the screen is off, or in always-on mode, clicking Camera Control just wakes up the screen.屏幕醒来后，您必须再次单击它，以跳到拍摄模式。苹果在这里的思考很明显：他们想在口袋里或从打开相机的钱包中进行摄像机控制的意外点击。 Unlike almost every other mode you can get into on an iPhone, when you're in shooting mode in Camera, the device won't go to sleep automatically after a minute or two of inactivity. The current default in iOS 18, in fact, is to auto-lock after just 30 seconds. （设置→显示和亮度→自动锁。）在拍摄模式下，相机应用程序将在睡觉之前保持很长时间。当iPhone放在口袋里时，您不希望这种情况无意间发生。

But what I've encountered over the last week are situations where my iPhone is in my pocket, and I see something fleeting I want to shoot.这件事在我的妻子和我上周五参加的韦泽音乐会上反复发生。 （很棒的表演。）我想要的是在将iPhone从口袋里取出时单击相机控制，并准备好在我的眼前拍摄时拍摄。这就是On/Oft按钮在我的Ricoh GR IIIX（例如我的Ricoh gr IIIX）上的专用相机上工作的方式。但是，使用iPhone 16，通常，将iPhone从我的口袋中取出时的相机控制的单击只是唤醒了屏幕，而不是将其放入拍摄模式。我需要再次单击它以进入拍摄模式。在短暂的时刻，这足以错过您想拍摄的镜头。 The whole point of this is being a quick-draw gunslinger.

Apple offers a more-protective option in Settings → Camera → Camera Control → Launch Camera to require a double click, rather than single click, to launch your specified camera app.当我写这篇文章时，我希望他们还提供一个不太保护的选项，即使手机已锁定并且屏幕已关闭，也可以单击一键启动相机应用程序。 A sort of “ I'll take my chances with accidental clicks ” option. It's possible though that Apple tried this, and found that inadvertent clicks are just too common.但是就目前而言，没有一个很好的方法可以始终尽快进入射击模式。

When the iPhone is locked and the screen is off, a double click of Camera Control will jump you into shooting mode. I started doing that over the weekend, and at first I thought it satisfied my desire.但是问题在于，如果iPhone已锁定，但屏幕已经醒了，双击相机控件将在第一次单击时跳入相机，并使用第二张照片拍摄照片。 I've had to delete at least half a dozen blurry accidental shots because of that.

A gesture that would avoid accidental invocations is clicking-and-holding the Camera Control button.从理论上讲，苹果可以将其作为启动相机的确定方式，同时将iPhone从口袋里拿出来。 But Apple has reserved the click-and-hold gesture for visual intelligence, a new Apple Intelligence feature announced last week. That's the feature that will put the nail in the coffin of dedicated “AI” devices like Humane's AI Pin and Rabbit's R1 . Visual intelligence isn't yet available, even in the developer betas of iOS 18.1, but the click-and-hold gesture is already reserved for it. 4

So where I've landed, at this writing, is trying to remember only to double-click Camera Control while taking my iPhone out of my pocket to shoot, and just sucking it up with the occasional blurry unwanted shot when I double-click Camera Control when the screen is already awake. The only other technique I can think to try is to remember to always wait until I see that the screen is awake before clicking Camera Control, tilting the phone if necessary to wake it, but that would seemingly defeat the purpose of getting into shooting mode as尽快。

By default, if you light-press-and-hold on Camera Control, nearly all of the UI elements disappear from the viewfinder screen. The shooting mode picker (Cinematic, Video, Photo, Portrait, Spatial, etc.), the zoom buttons (0.5×, 1×, 2×, 5×), the front/rear camera toggle, the thumbnail of your most recent photo — all of that disappears from the screen, leaving it about as uncluttered as the original iPhone Camera interface. Think of it as a half-press while using Camera Control as a shutter button. Dedicated hardware cameras have, for many decades, offered two-stage shutter buttons that work similarly. With those dedicated cameras, you press halfway to lock in a focus distance and exposure; then you can move the camera to recompose the frame while keeping the focus distance and exposure locked, before pressing fully to capture the image. Apple has promised to bring this feature to the Camera app for all iPhone 16 models in a software update “later this year”. (It's not there yet in iOS 18.1 beta 4.) Camera Control does not have quite the same precise feel as a true two-stage shutter button that physically clicks at two separate points of depression (two detents ), but it might eventually, in future iPhone models.

One issue with Camera Control is that because it's capacitive, it's tricky for case makers. The obvious solution is to just put a cutout around it, letting the user's finger touch the actual Camera Control button. Apple's more elegant solution, on their own silicone and clear cases and the new glossy polycarbonate cases from their subsidiary Beats , is “a sapphire crystal, coupled to a conductive layer to communicate the finger movements to the Camera Control”. That doesn't sound like something you're going to see in cheap $20 cases. In my testing, both with Apple's cases and Beats's, it works fairly seamlessly. I do think you lose some of the feel from the haptic feedback on light presses, though. Ultimately, Camera Control makes it more true than ever before that the best way to use an iPhone is without a case.

One more thing on Camera Control. Of the features that are adjustable via Camera Control (again: Exposure, Depth (ƒ-stop), Zoom, Cameras, Style, Tone), “Cameras” is an easily overlooked standout. Zoom offers continuous decimal increments from 0.5× to 25.0×. That is to say, you can slide your finger to get zoom values like 1.7×, 3.3×, 17.4×, etc. I almost never want that. I want to stick to the precise true optical increments: 0.5×, 1×, 2×, and 5×. That's what the “Cameras” setting mode offers. Think of it as Zoom, but only with those precise values. (Instead of “Cameras”, this setting could have been called “Lenses”, but that's potentially confusing because 1× and 2× both come from the same physical lens; the difference is how the sensor data is treated.) In fact, I wish I could go into Settings and disable Zoom from the list of features available in Camera Control. If I ever really want a non-optical zoom level, I can use the existing on-screen interface options .

What's obvious is that Camera Control clearly was conceived of, designed, and engineered by photography aficionados within Apple who are intimately familiar with how great dedicated cameras work and feel. It surely must have been championed, politically, by the same group. It's really just rather astounding that there is now a hardware control dedicated to photography on all new iPhones — and a mechanically complex control at that.

Photography, Aside From Camera Control

As usual, I'll leave it to other reviewers to do in-depth pixel-peeping comparisons of image quality, but suffice it to say, to my eyes, the iPhone 16 Pro (the review unit I've been daily driving this past week) camera seems as great as usual.

The big new photographic feature this year has nothing to do with lenses or sensors. It's a next-generation Photographic Styles, and it's effectively “RAW for the rest of us”. This has always been the edge of my personal photographic nerdery/enthusiasm. I care enough about photography to have purchased numerous thousand-ish dollar cameras (and lenses ) over the decades, but shooting RAW has never stuck for me. I understand what it is, and why it is technically superior to shooting JPEG/HEIC, but it's just too much work. RAW lets you achieve better results through manual development in post, but you have to develop in post because raw RAW images (sorry) look strikingly flat and unsaturated. For a while I tried shooting RAW + JPEG, where each image you take is stored both as a straight-off-the-sensor RAW file and a goes-through-the-camera-imaging-pipeline JPEG file, but it turned out I never ever went back and developed those RAW images. And relative to JPEG/HEIC (which, henceforth, I'm just going to call “shooting JPEG” for brevity, even though iPhones have defaulted to the more-efficient HEIC format since iOS 11 seven years ago ), RAW images take up 10× (or more) storage space.

It's just too much hassle. The increase in image quality I can eke out developing RAW just isn't worth the effort it takes — for me. For many serious photographers, it is. Everyone has a line like that. Some people don't do any editing at all. They never crop, never change exposure in post, never apply filters — they just point and shoot and they're done. For me, that line is shooting RAW.

Apple first introduced Photographic Styles with the iPhones 13 three years ago, with four self-descriptive primary styles: Rich Contrast (my choice), Vibrant, Warm, and Cool. Each primary style offered customization. Find a style you like, set it as your default, and go about your merry way. But whatever style you chose was how your photos were “developed” by the iPhone hardware imaging pipeline. Apple's “filters” have been non-destructive for years, but the first generation of Photographic Styles are baked into the HEIC files it writes to storage.

With the iPhone 16 lineup, this feature is now significantly more powerful, while remaining just as convenient and easy to use. 5 Apple eliminated what used to be called “filters” and recreated the better ones (eg Vibrant and Dramatic) as styles. There are now 15 base styles to choose from, most of them self-descriptively named (Neutral, Gold, Rose Gold), some more poetically named (Cozy, Quiet, Ethereal). The default style is named Standard, and it processes images in a way that looks, well, iPhone-y. The two that have me enamored thus far are Natural and Stark B&W. Standard iPhone image processing has long looked, to many of our eyes, at least slightly over-processed. Too much noise reduction, too much smoothing. A little too punchy. Natural really does look more natural, in a good way, to my eyes. Stark B&W brings to mind classic high-contrast black-and-white films like Kodak Tri-X 400 .

A key aspect of Photographic Styles now is that they're non-destructive. You can change your mind about any of it in post. Set your default to Stark B&W and later on, editing in Photos, you can change your mind and go back to a full-color image using whichever other style you want. There's a lot of complex image processing going on behind the scenes — both in the iPhone 16 hardware and iOS 18 software — to make this seem like no big deal at all. But because the new Photographic Styles are largely (or entirely?) based on the hardware imaging pipeline, iPhones 13–15 will continue to use the first-generation Photographic Styles, even after upgrading to iOS 18.

I've always felt a little guilty about the fact that I'm too lazy to shoot RAW. This next-generation Photographic Styles feature in the iPhone 16 lineup might assuage, I suspect, the remaining vestiges of that guilt.

Design — and the Pro vs. Regular Question

Apple kindly supplied me with all four models in the iPhone 16 lineup for review: the 16 in ultramarine, 16 Plus in pink, 16 Pro in natural titanium, and 16 Pro Max in desert titanium. Ultramarine is my favorite color color on any iPhone in memory. It's a fun poppy blue, and quite vibrant. Pink is good too, with to my (and my wife's) eyes, a touch of purple to it. The colors are extra saturated on the camera bumps, which looks great. Natural titanium looks extremely similar, if not identical, to the natural titanium on last year's iPhone 15 Pro. (Apple's own Compare page makes it appear as though this year's natural titanium is noticeably lighter than last year's, but here's a photo from me showing a natural 15 Pro Max and 16 Pro side-by-side .) Desert titanium is sort of more gold than tan, but there is some brown to it, without rendering it the least bit Zune -like.

In short, the regular iPhone 16 offers some colors that truly pop. The iPhone 16 Pro models remain, as with all previous “Pro” iPhone colorways, staid shades of gray. White-ish gray, gray gray, near-black gray, and now desert gray.

I always buy black, or the closest to black Apple offers, and this tweet I wrote back in 2009 remains true, so the only year I've ever had a “which color to buy?” personal dilemma was 2016 with the iPhones 7 , which Apple offered in both a matte “black” and Vader-like glossy “jet black”. 6 I still kind of can't believe Apple offered two utterly different blacks in the same model year.

But “which model to buy?” is sometimes more of a dilemma for yours truly. In 2020 I bought a regular iPhone 12, not the 12 Pro, on the grounds that it weighed less and felt better in hand than the Pro models. Whatever the non-pro iPhone 12 lacked in photographic capabilities wouldn't matter so much, I correctly guessed, while I remained mostly homebound during the COVID epidemic. But I was also tempted, sorely, by the 12 Mini, and in hindsight I really don't remember why that's not the model I bought that year.

It's a good thing, and a sign of strength for Apple, when the regular iPhone models are extremely appealing even to power users. It seemed like an artificial restriction last year, for example, that only the 15 Pro model got the new Action button. The year prior , only the 14 Pro models got the Dynamic Island; the regular iPhone 14 models were stuck with a no-fun notch. If you're fairly deep into the weeds regarding TSMC's first-generation 3nm fabrication, it makes sense why only the iPhone 15 Pro models got a new chip (the A17 Pro — there was no regular A17) while the iPhone 15 models stayed on the year-old A16, but still, that was a bummer too. This year, the regular 16 and 16 Plus not only get the Action button, they get the new Camera Control too (which, as I opined above, would make more sense as a “pro” feature than the Action button did last year), and a new A18 chip fabricated with TSMC's second-generation 3nm process.

For my own use I've preordered an iPhone 16 Pro. But for the first time since the aforementioned iPhone 12 in 2020, I was genuinely tempted by the regular iPhone 16. The biggest functional difference between the 16 and 16 Pro models is that only the 16 Pros have a third telephoto lens. Last year, the 15 Pro Max went to 5×, but the 15 Pro remained at 3×. This year, both the 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max have the 5× telephoto lens. I tend to think I seldom use the telephoto lens, but it turns out I used it a little more in the last year than I would have guessed. Using smart albums in Photos to sort images by camera and lens , it looks like out of 3,890 total photos I shot with my iPhone 15 Pro, the breakdown by camera lens went like this:

相机光学变焦照片百分比
超宽0.5×第338章9%
主要的1×/2× 3,076 79%
长焦3×第476章12%

And, eyeballing the photos in that telephoto lens smart album, for most of them, I could have used a little more reach. I don't expect to use 5× more often than I used 3×, but I expect to get better shots when I do. But it's also the case that a fair number of the photos in that telephoto smart album are shots I just don't care about that much. I do use the telephoto lens, and I look forward to having a 5× one instead of 3×, but I could live without it entirely and not miss it too much. (I only have 8 videos shot using 3× from the last year. Longer lenses are not good focal lengths for handheld video.)

Aesthetically, the two-lens arrangement on the back of the iPhones 16 and 16 Plus is far more pleasing than the three-lens triangle-in-a-square arrangement on the iPhones 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max.

For the last few years (the iPhone 13, 14, and 15 generations), the aesthetic difference in the back camera systems hasn't been so striking, because Apple placed the non-pro iPhones' two lenses in a diagonal arrangement inside a square堵塞。 The two lenses on the backs of the iPhones 11 and 12 were aligned on the same axis (vertical, when holding the phone in tallscreen orientation), but they were still inside a raised square. You'd have to go back to 2018's iPhone XS to find a two-lens iPhone with the iPhone 16's pleasing pill-shaped bump.

Either you care about such purely aesthetic concerns or you don't.我在乎。 Not enough to purchase an iPhone 16 instead of a 16 Pro, but it was a factor. The iPhone 16 and 16 Plus simply look more pleasing from the back and feel better in hand, especially caseless, than any iPhone since 2018.

Here's the pricing for the entire iPhone 16 lineup:

模型128GB 256GB 512GB 1TB
16 800 美元900 美元1,100 美元—
16加号900 美元1,000 美元1,200 美元—
16专业版1,000 美元1,100 美元1,300 美元1,500 美元
16 Pro Max — 1,200 美元1,400 美元1,600 美元

But perhaps a better way to compare is by size class. Regular size:

模型128GB 256GB 512GB 1TB
16 800 美元900 美元1,100 美元—
16专业版1,000 美元1,100 美元1,300 美元1,500 美元

And big-ass size:

模型128GB 256GB 512GB 1TB
16加号900 美元1,000 美元1,200 美元—
16 Pro Max — 1,200 美元1,400 美元1,600 美元

At both size classes, it's a $200 delta to go from the regular model to its Pro equivalent. Looking at Apple's excellent-as-always Compare page , here are the advantages/exclusive features that jump out to me for the 16 Pro models, other than the extra telephoto camera lens, roughly in the order in which I personally care:

  • Always-on display.
  • ProMotion display (adaptive refresh rates up to 120 Hz vs. 60 Hz).
  • An extra GPU core (6 vs. 5), which Geekbench 6 benchmarks as 17 percent faster. Call it 20 percent if you trust core count more than Geekbench.
  • Night mode portrait photos.
  • LiDAR scanner, which I presume is a (or the ?) reason why Night mode portrait photos are Pro-exclusive.
  • “Studio-quality four-mic array”. I put that in quotes not to express skepticism but because I haven't tested it or compared it against the iPhone 16. But it, uh, sounds like a great new feature.
  • USB 3 support vs. USB 2, for “up to 20× faster transfers”.
  • A roughly 4 percent faster CPU in both single- and multi-core performance, according to Geekbench 6.
  • Ability to shoot Dolby Vision video up to 4K at 120 fps.
  • Apple ProRAW photos and ProRes videos (and other pro video features like log video recording and ACES).

I think it's amazing that the iPhone Pro models are now able to shoot professional-caliber video. But I don't shoot video professionally. And because I don't, I can't remember the last time I needed to transfer data from my iPhone via the USB-C port, so, while the Pro models offer a noticeable advantage in USB performance, I might never use it personally在接下来的一年里。

Another difference is that the 16 Pro models have slightly bigger displays than the regular 16 models. The 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max are 6.3 and 6.9 inches; the regular 16 and 16 Plus are 6.1 and 6.7. Whether that's actually an advantage for the Pro models depends on whether you care that they're also slightly taller and heavier devices in hand.

电池寿命

I omitted from the above comparison the one spec people care most about: battery life. Here is the sleeper spec where the Pro models earn their keep. Once again grouping like-vs.-like size classes, and including the 15 Pro models for year-over-year comparison:

模型视频Video (streamed)
15专业版23小时20小时
16 22小时18小时
16专业版27小时22小时
15 专业最大29 hours 25小时
16加号27小时24小时
16 Pro Max 33小时29 hours

Those battery life numbers come from Apple, not my own testing (and Apple cites them as “up to” numbers). But those numbers suggest 20 percent longer battery life on the 16 Pro models compared to their size-class non-pro counterparts. Anecdotally, that feels true to me. I use a Shortcuts automation to turn on Low Power mode whenever my iPhone battery level drops below 35 percent. With my iPhone 15 Pro, that generally happens every night at some point. Over the last week using the iPhone 16 Pro as my primary iPhone, it hasn't dropped that low most nights. To say the least, that's not a rigorous test in any way, shape, or form. But Apple has no history of exaggerating battery life claims, especially relative comparisons between devices. I think it's the real deal, and the 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max probably get 20 percent longer battery life than their corresponding 16 and 16 Plus counterparts, and between 10–15 percent over last year's Pro models, in practical day-to-day使用。

That alone might be worth a big chunk of the $200 price difference to some people.

苹果情报

I spent the weekdays last week running iOS 18.0; on Friday afternoon, I upgraded my 16 Pro review unit to the developer beta of iOS 18.1 (beta 3 at the time, since upgraded to beta 4). I'm sure many, if not most reviewers, will review only what comes in the box, and what's coming in the box this week will be iOS 18.0 without any Apple Intelligence features.

That stance is fair enough, but I don't see it as a big deal to include my 18.1 experience in this review. iOS 18.1 feels pretty close to shipping. Apple has promised “October”, and my gut feeling, using it for the last five days on this review unit, is that it's pretty solid. I suspect it might ship closer to early October than late October. But even if it doesn't appear until Halloween, I don't think it's absurd or offensive that Apple is already using Apple Intelligence to market the iPhone 16 lineup. It's a little awkward right now, but it's not a sham. It's vaporware until it actually ships, but it's vaporware that anyone with a developer account can install right now.

Also, none of the Apple Intelligence features currently in iOS 18.1 are game-changing. The Clean Up feature in Photos is pretty good, and when it doesn't produce good results, you can simply revert to the original. The AI-generated summaries of messages, notifications, and emails in Mail are at times apt, but at others not so much . I haven't tried the Rewrite tool because I'm, let's face it, pretty confident in my own writing ability. But, after my own final editing pass, I ran this entire review through the Proofread feature, and it correctly flagged seven mistakes I missed, and an eighth that I had marked, but had forgotten to fix. Most of its suggestions that I have chosen to ignore were, by the book, legitimate. (Eg, it suggested replacing the jargon-y lede with the standard spelling lead . It also flagged my stubborn capitalization of “MacOS”.) It took 1 minute, 45 seconds to complete the proofreading pass of the 7,200+ words in Apple Notes on iPhone 16 Pro。 (Subsequent to the original publication of this review, I tried the Rewrite function on the text of it, for shits and giggles, and the only way I can describe the results is that it gave up.)

New Siri definitely offers a cooler-looking visual interface. And the new Siri voices sound more natural. But it also feels like Siri is speaking too slowly, as though Siri hails from the Midwest or something. (Changing Siri's speaking rate to 110 percent in Settings → Accessibility → Siri sounds much more natural to my ears, and feels like it matches old Siri's speaking rate.) Type to Siri is definitely cool, but I don't see why we couldn't have had that feature since 2010. I have actually used the new “Product Knowledge” feature, where Siri draws upon knowledge from Apple's own support documentation, while writing this review.这很棒。 But maybe Apple's support website should have had better search years ago?

These are all good features. But let's say you never heard of LLMs or ChatGPT. And instead, at WWDC this year, without any overarching “Apple Intelligence” marketing umbrella, Apple had simply announced features like a new cool-looking Siri interface, typing rather than talking to Siri, being able to remove unwanted background objects from photos, a “proofreading” feature for the standard text system that extends and improves the years-old but (IMO) kinda lame grammar-checking feature on MacOS, and brings it to iOS too? Those would seem like totally normal features Apple might add this year. But not tentpole features. These Apple Intelligence features strike me as nothing more than the sort of nice little improvements Apple makes across its OSes every year.

Apple reiterated throughout last week's “It's Glowtime” keynote, and now in its advertising for the iPhone 16 lineup , that these are the first iPhones “built for Apple Intelligence from the ground up”. I'm not buying that. These are simply the second generation of iPhone models with enough RAM to run on-device LLMs. LLMs are breakthrough technology. But they're breakthroughs at the implementation level. The technology is fascinating and important, but so are things like the Swift programming language. I spent the first half of my time testing the iPhone 16 Pro running iOS 18.0 and the second half running 18.1 with Apple Intelligence. A few things got a little nicer.就是这样。

I might be underselling how impossible the Clean Up feature would be without generative AI. I am very likely underselling how valuable the new writing tools might prove to people trying to write in a second language, or who simply aren't capable of expressing themselves well in their first language. But like I said, they're all good features. I just don't see them as combining to form the collective tentpole that Apple is marketing “Apple Intelligence” as. I get it that from Apple's perspective, engineering-wise, it's like adding an entire platform to the existing OS. It's a massive engineering effort and the on-device execution constraints are onerous. But from a user's perspective, they're just ... features. When's the last year Apple has not added cool new features along the scope of these?

Apple's just riding — and now, through the impressive might of its own advertising and marketing, contributing to — the AI hype wave, and I find that a little eye-roll inducing. It would have been cooler, in an understated breathe-on-your-fingernails-and-polish-them-on-your-shirt kind of way, if Apple had simply added these same new features across their OSes without the marketing emphasis being on the “Apple Intelligence” umbrella. If not for the AI hype wave the industry is currently caught in, this emphasis on which features are part of “Apple Intelligence” would seem as strange as Apple emphasizing, in advertisements, which apps are now built using SwiftUI.

If the iPhone 16 lineup was “built from the ground up” with a purpose in mind, it's to serve as the best prosumer cameras ever made. Not to create cartoon images of a dog blowing out candles on a birthday cake . The new lineup of iPhones 16 are amazing devices. The non-pro iPhone 16 and 16 Plus arguably offer the best value-per-dollar of any iPhones Apple has ever made. This emphasis on Apple Intelligence distracts from that.

The problem isn't that Apple is marketing Apple Intelligence a few weeks before it's actually going to ship. It's that few of these features are among the coolest or most interesting things about the new iPhone 16 lineup, and none are unique advantages that only Apple has the ability or inclination to offer. 7 Every phone on the market will soon be able to generate impersonal saccharine passages of text and uncanny-valley images via LLMs. Only Apple has the talent and passion to create something as innovative and genuinely useful as Camera Control.

  1. While I'm reminiscing, allow me to reiterate my belief that the icon on the iPhone Home button is the single greatest icon ever designed. In my 2017 review of the iPhone X , I wrote:

    The fundamental premise of iOS Classic is that a running app gets the entire display, and the Home button is how you interact with the system to get out of the current app and into another. Before Touch ID, the Home button was even labeled with a generic empty “app” icon, an iconographic touch of brilliance. [...]

    I find it hard to consider a world where that button was marked by an icon that looked like a house (the overwhelmingly common choice for a “home” icon) or printed with the word “ HOME ” (the way iPods had a “ MENU ”按钮）。 Early iPhone prototypes did, in fact, have a “ MENU ” label on the button .

    I truly consider the iPhone Home button icon the single best icon ever. It perfectly represented anything and everything apps could be — it was iconic in every sense of the word.

    ↩︎

  2. It's almost unfathomable how much of a pain in the ass voicemail was before the iPhone. Rather than manage messages on screen, you placed a phone call to your carrier and interfaced with their system by punching number buttons. You had to deal with each message sequentially. “Press 1 to play, 2 to go to the next message, 7 to delete.” And you had to actually listen to the messages to know who they were from.太可怕了。 ↩︎︎

  3. Unless, I suppose, you live in the EU and have exercised your hard-earned right to delete it . ↩︎︎

  4. That's the only way to launch visual intelligence, which means the feature is exclusive to the iPhone 16 lineup and won't be available on iPhone 15 Pros. I'm truly looking forward to this feature, so that's a bummer for iPhone 15 Pro owners. ↩︎︎

  5. Here's Apple's brief documentation for the old Photographic Styles feature (iPhones 13, 14, 15) and the new version (iPhones 16). ↩︎︎

  6. Jet black aluminum is back, and as Vader-esque as it was on the iPhone 7 in 2016, with a new colorway for the Apple Watch Series 10 this year. I have a review unit in jet black on my wrist and it's so great. ↩︎︎

  7. It's fair to argue that Private Cloud Compute is uniquely Apple. Not that Apple is the only company that could build out such an infrastructure for guaranteed-private off-device AI processing, but among the few companies that could do it, Apple is the only one that cares so deeply about privacy that they would. I do not expect Private Cloud Compute to be replicated by Google, Samsung, Meta, Amazon, or Microsoft. Nor any of the AI startups like OpenAI or Anthropic. They simply don't care enough to do it the hard way. Apple does. But that belongs in the marketing for Apple's ongoing Privacy campaign, not for the iPhones 16 in particular. ↩︎︎

Back in July 2007, I contributed this photo to a Flickr group called, self-describingly, “The Items We Carry”:

These are Apple's three “everyday carry” products. They're as much a part of our lives as our clothes and glasses and jewelry. They thus go together swimmingly in the same product introduction event.
Last week's “It's Glowtime” event was very strong for Apple. It might have been the single strongest iPhone event since the introduction of the iPhone X. All three platforms are now in excellent, appealing, and coherent shape:
iPhone: Last year was a bit “meh” for the non-pro iPhone 15 models, which were stuck with year-old A16 silicon and didn't get the new hardware Action button. This year, the iPhone 16 and 16 Plus get the brand-new A18 chip, the Action button, and the new Camera Control button. That Camera Control button would have made total sense as a Pro-exclusive feature this year (more sense, to me, than making the Action button Pro-exclusive last year) but all new iPhones have it. This year's iPhone 16 and 16 Plus even come in the best and most fun colors in a few years . The iPhone 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max have best-in-class camera systems, the A18 Pro chip (6 GPUs vs. 5 in the regular A18, bigger CPU caches, faster memory and storage I/O), and slightly bigger screens. 3 The iPhone remains the best product in the most important and profitable device category the world has ever seen.
Apple Watch: The new Series 10 models sport bigger displays, longer battery life, and 10 percent reductions in thickness and weight. The new watch displays are slightly bigger, and, more importantly, also have noticeably wider viewing angles, and in always-on mode update once per second instead of once per minute. There's an absolutely gorgeous polished jet black option in aluminum — marking, to my taste, the first time in the entire history of Apple Watch that there's a base-priced aluminum model that stands toe-to-toe with the more expensive models on aesthetic grounds 。 But those more expensive models are better than ever too, with Apple replacing polished stainless steel with much lighter polished titanium. I was unaware that titanium could be polished to a mirror-like sheen. Apple had previously made Series models of Apple Watch in titanium — I bought one in Series 5 and again in Series 7 — but those were at the Edition tier, priced above the stainless steel models. There was no Ultra 3 announcement — the lone sour note in the Watch segment — but the Ultra 2 is now available in an excellent and sure-to-be-popular satin black DLC coating .
AirPods: No more selling years-old models at entry-level prices. The new good/better/best lineup is clear. Good: new AirPods 4 for $129. Better: AirPods 4 with Active Noise Cancellation (ANC) and a better case (with wireless charging and Find My support, including a speaker) for $179. Best: the existing $249 AirPods Pro, which, yes, debuted two years ago , but which continue to be updated with improved functionality via firmware updates — most notably and importantly now, certified support for use as hearing aids. There's also the revised AirPods Max, with new colors and USB-C replacing Lightning, but alas, no significant internal updates like the H2 chip now available in all other AirPod models, which powers features like voice isolation and nod/shake-your-head Siri interactions or lossless audio support. That's a slightly sour note, but on the whole, the AirPods lineup looks (and sounds) better than ever.

Jobs often wore his heart on his shirtsleeve, not merely in public but on stage. Remember the 2010 WWDC keynote, when Jobs had an iPhone demo fail because the Wi-Fi wasn't working, and 20 minutes later he came back on stage and angrily demanded that the media turn off their portable Wi-Fi base stations being used for live-blogging the keynote? He was fucking angry and he let us know it. You simply didn't mess with a Steve Jobs keynote.
Cook almost never reveals his true passionate self in public. But at least one time he did. At the 2014 annual shareholders meeting, Cook faced a question from a representative of the right-wing National Center for Public Policy Research (NCPPR). As reported by Bryan Chaffin at The Mac Observer :
During the question and answer session, however, the NCPPR representative asked Mr. Cook two questions, both of which were in line with the principles espoused in the group's proposal. The first question challenged an assertion from Mr. Cook that Apple's sustainability programs and goals — Apple plans on having 100 percent of its power come from green sources — are good for the bottom line.
The representative asked Mr. Cook if that was the case only because of government subsidies on green energy. Mr. Cook didn't directly answer that question, but instead focused on the second question: the NCPPR representative asked Mr. Cook to commit right then and there to doing only those things that were profitable.
What ensued was the only time I can recall seeing Tim Cook angry, and he categorically rejected the worldview behind the NCPPR's advocacy. He said that there are many things Apple does because they are right and just, and that a return on investment (ROI) was not the primary consideration on such issues.
“When we work on making our devices accessible by the blind,” he said, “I don't consider the bloody ROI.” He said the same thing about environmental issues, worker safety, and other areas where Apple is a leader.
As evidenced by the use of “bloody” in his response — the closest thing to public profanity I've ever seen from Mr. Cook — it was clear that he was quite angry. His body language changed, his face contracted, and he spoke in rapid fire sentences compared to the usual metered and controlled way he speaks.
He didn't stop there, however, as he looked directly at the NCPPR representative and said, “If you want me to do things only for ROI reasons, you should get out of this stock.”
A philosophy of “Whatever is best for the ROI” is McKinsey-flavored cowardice, not leadership. Sometimes a leader needs to make decisions with uncertain business sense, or even knowing that the decision doesn't make business sense, but simply because their intuition or conscience tell them it's the right thing to do. Insofar as he's willing to make such decisions, Cook is like Jobs. But what sort of decisions those are, are very different.
Jobs was driven to improve the way computers work. Cook is driven to improve the way humans live. Accessibility and the environment are much higher priorities under Cook than they were under Jobs. Apple's entire foray into Health has occurred under Cook's leadership — and Health-related features were tentpole features in last week's keynote. I wouldn't be surprised if it cost far more money to get AirPods Pro certified as medical-grade hearing aids than Apple will make back in profits from an increase in sales. The Apple 2030 initiative to bring the company's entire carbon footprint to net zero emissions is fundamentally about doing the right thing, not just selling more products.
Jobs emphasized making more interesting products, and maximizing surprise and delight upon their unveilings. Tim Cook wouldn't have sent the police after Gizmodo's purloined iPhone 4 prototype ; Steve Jobs probably thought Apple took it easy on them.
Cook values predictability. But predictability is in conflict with quirkiness. You don't need to even recognize Mark Gurman's name to have predicted that last week's event would focus on new iPhones, new AirPods, and new Apple Watches. Nor do you need to follow the rumor mill to have correctly guessed that all of those new products would look very similar to the models that preceded them. Evolve, evolve, evolve. There's no resting on laurels inside Apple with any of those products. The iPhones 16, Apple Watch Series 10, and AirPods 4 are all the result of intensely-focused industry-leading engineering (including in fields like material engineering) and design. But they also all basically look exactly like all of us expected them to look.

That fat Nano was quirky. It was also, in hindsight, obviously a mistake. I'm quite sure that inside Apple there were designers and product people who thought it was a mistake before it shipped. That's ultimately why Cook's Apple is more successful — with more customers, more revenue, higher margins (and thus more profit), and more, well, sheer dominance (and, thus, more regulatory scrutiny). But it's also why Cook's Apple delivers fewer surprises. Tim Cook's Apple has not missed any fundamental new technology or shift that would have resulted in industry-changing new products or platforms that, if he'd lived, Steve Jobs would have led Apple to create through his singular genius or sheer force of will. But I also don't think we'd have been left with new iPhones 16 that look like last year's iPhones 15, which looked like the iPhones 14, which looked like the iPhones 13, which looked like the iPhones 12, which looked like the iPhones 11 except that year the side rails went from rounded back to flat, like the iPhone 4 and 5 models. I can show you an iPhone 4 and you'll know, instantly, that it is either an iPhone 4 or 4S. I can show you an iPhone 5 and you'll know it's either an iPhone 5 or 5S (or the first iPhone SE ). If it were a black-and-slate iPhone 5 you might even know it's a 5 specifically, not a 5S, because the anodization of the black iPhone 5 wore off over time, producing a weathered look — a patina — that I found endearing in an evocative way no subsequent iPhone has. It was an imperfection, but sometimes imperfections are what we love most about products. 5 Show me an iPhone from 2020–2024 a decade from now and I'll have to remember exactly when the Action button and Camera Control appeared to know which was which.
Cook has patience where Jobs would grow restless. In the Jobs era, when a keynote ended, we'd sometimes turn to each other and say, “Can you believe ____?” No one asked that after last week's keynote. Much of what Apple announced was impressive. Very little was disappointing. Nothing was hard to believe or surprising.
This isn't bad for Apple, or a sign of institutional decline. If anything, under Cook, Apple more consistently achieves near-perfection. Tolerances are tighter. Ship dates seldom slip. But it's a change that makes the company less fun to keenly observe and obsess over. Cook's Apple is not overly cautious, but it's never reckless. Jobs's Apple was occasionally reckless, for better and worse .
My dissatisfaction flying home from last week's event is, ultimately, selfish. I miss having my mind blown. I miss being utterly surprised. I miss occasionally being disappointed by a product design that stretched quirky all the way to wacky . I miss being amazed by something entirely unexpected out of left field. Poor me, stuck only with the announcement of noticeably improved versions of three products — three product families — that zillions of people around the world, myself included, carry with us wherever we go.
